document_title: What is a cerebral aneurysm? Common locations and treatments
subsection_content:
In fact, any arterial area in the brain can form a brain aneurysm. Normally, more than 1 cerebral aneurysm can form in the brain. Among them, cerebral aneurysm or aortic aneurysm is the most common type of cerebral aneurysm, accounting for about 90% of all cases. Cerebral aneurysms often occur in arteries located in front of the brain, especially in the branching area of ​​the cerebral blood vessels at the base of the brain. (first)
In addition, dissecting aneurysms and fusiform aneurysms are also two common types of brain aneurysms. Specifically:
Fusiform aneurysms are considered to be the result of damage from severe atherosclerotic plaques in the brain; The location that usually appears is in the basilar circuit.; A dissecting aneurysm is a collection of blood inside the vessel wall and is often related to high blood pressure or brain injury.
